Description: Round-topped limestone stela of Gebu, divided into four registers: 1 - Two wedjat-eyes. 2 - Six rows of Hieroglyphic text. 3 - Scene of the deceased seated before an offering-table and a standing male and kneeling female figure. 4 - Eleven columns of Hieroglyphic text.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.23)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son to Luxor's Sands
